technology.short_description: A soldier that has faced many a defeat is less likely to just run away at the first sign of trouble.

effects.description: Leadership: +1 per experience rank for all units

technology.short_description: "See the scruffy one with the bandage and the limp? Pick that one. Just do it."
"You think that's scary? Wake me up when it starts spitting fire all over the pl-Alright, alright, bloody Myrmidia, I'm coming."

effects.description: Melee defence: +3 for Adventurers, Carabiniers and Carlsson Militia units
Passive ability: "Discombobulate" for Adventurers, Carabiniers and Carlsson Militia units

technology.short_description: Mercenaries know how to make their risky lives a little bit more sustainable. Surely not for the others.
It can't be ignored - Tilea is the land of art, wealth and continuous warfare. Tilean mercenaries are highly valued for reasons beyond their funny accent.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +3 for Mercenary Captains
Armour: +10 for Pikemen and Pavise Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: Anybody can wash up in Tilea as a mercenary, and anybody with a talent for warfare can be put to use.

effects.description:
Unlocks 2 of the following units in the Renown pool, replenishing randomly across 15 turns: 
	War Wagons, Light Scouts

technology.short_description: The highlanders of the Irrana Mountains are renowned for their odd drinks and effective skirmishers.
Kislev
Kislev
"Nothing but tha best armour here-a! Quarrel tested! Money back guaranteed if it breaks!"

effects.description: Armour: +10 for all heavy armour units

technology.short_description: "See here, we have to form up the troops into curved arrows and drive them deep into the enemy oblongs. What? Diagrams are clear."
In a heterogeneous mercenary army, coordination is key to victory. And a well-cooperating host is like an unstoppable grinder.
When you are the one holding the lit candle for the surgeon to amputate your own leg, you got your troops full respect until the day you die.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.short_description: By the union of impenetrable pike formations, daring cavalry actions and, of course, substantial economical support, Tilean warfare can reign supreme.

effects.description: Base Weapon damage: +3 for Duellists, Pikemen, Republican Guard and cavalry units

technology.short_description: Kislev
These soldiers may appear out of touch and out of the loop with modern warfare, but they're far from ineffective.
The New World is a shrine of dangers and secrets, expensive ones. The most common trinket a bait to destruction or an unthinkable tool of power.
The wealth of the Southern Realms flows through sea and land, into chests and pockets, and back again.

effects.description: Melee attack and Melee defence: +4 for Duellists and Montante Swordsmen

technology.short_description: Actual war is only the last resort in the art of diplomacy, and leverage is just another kind of artillery.
The Cult of Myrmidia abhors Chaos in all its forms, and when it draws near, the Order of the Eagle must take arms.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +20% for Priestesses, High Eagles and Myrmidian units

technology.short_description: Inspired by the fabled might of Tylos, by the elven legacy and driven by the pent-up potential in the wealthy Tilea of nowadays, one might think of ways to overcome the usual tilean rivalry for something greater...

We need to encourage the building of new chapterhouses in our territories if we want the support of the Myrmidian Orders, who so far considered the Border Princes not quite important enough. They weren't wrong, mind you.

effects.description: Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -50% for Knights of the Righteous Spear and Sisters of Fury

technology.short_description: Even as far as the New World, famous mercenaries can be persuaded to come, or even found locally.

effects.description: Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition

Unlocked in the Renown pool:
	Pirazzo's Lost Legion
	Knights of Origo
	Cursed Company

technology.short_description: Most Condottieri won't leave home without a company or two of toughened veterans. Others will want a jewel to their hat in the way of a famous regiment.

effects.description:
Unlocked in the Renown pool:
	Marksmen of Miragliano
	Vespero's Vendetta
	Leopard Company

technology.short_description: When the conditions and prospects of profit are right, even the expense behind recruiting and convincing the very best mercenaries in the Southern Realms can be justified...

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

Unlocked in the Renown pool:
	Braganza's Besiegers
	Ricco's Republican Guard
	Voland's Venators
	Bronzino's Galloper Guns

technology.short_description: If one could stack Leonardo da Miragliano's sketches in a pile, they'd probably reach Morrslieb. Upstart polymath Ugoletti has expressed interest in trying to make sense in one of these, so far kept secret. A wooden vehicle of bizarre shape, but the crank design looks all wrong...
The prototype seems to be somewhat working after bypassing Leonardo's puzzles, but Ugoletti needs more funding to improve the construction process and design. Your treasurers are murmuring.

Ugoletti claims that he can perfect the design, if only he could get his hands on an efficient power source; however, his sauce-splattered notes are exceedingly nebulous and he seems to be falling prey to hyperactive paranoia. If only one would fund an expedition to the jungles, for one of those things he calls Solar Engines...

effects.description: Missile strength and reload: +10% for Tortoise Tanks

Unlocked in the Renown pool:
	 Ugoletti's Floating Ordnance (Tortoise Tank)

technology.short_description: A powerful, authoritative voice in any Hold, the Guilds dominate Dwarfen civil life, controlling trade, finances and labour.
